intro: Achillea pinnata, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and red, bloom from late spring to early autumn. Achillea pinnata is often used in traditional medicine and as a garden ornamental due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
